title.narrative: PREVENTION AND RESPONSE TO CHOLERA

description.narrative: Health districts and municipalities are able to prevent and respond to cholera outbreaks in the target areas, which contributes to Disaster Risk Reduction, Disaster Risk Reduction (Covid), Sanitation. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children and women in vulnerable regions use drinking water points and sanitation facilities and adopt good hygiene practices, including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Health districts and municipalities are able to prevent and respond to cholera outbreaks in the target areas

description.narrative: While the COVID-19 pandemic is still rampant, the country has declared a chorea epidemic in October 2021. With the experience gained in COVID-19 response, timely cholera preparedness WASH items pre-positioned il 100% of the Districts at risk, the response has been prompt. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:01/02/2022
